topic: Man killed by his own tank

prompts.image_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style. A dramatic, cinematic wide shot. A solitary catfolk mechanic in WWI uniform stands silhouetted against a desolate, muddy landscape. Beside him looms the massive, brutal shape of an early WWI tank (Mark IV style). Limited palette, visible pixel grid. Ominous atmosphere.
prompts.video_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style, seamless loop. A cinematic, low-angle shot of the massive WWI tank and the silhouetted catfolk mechanic. Slow, subtle push-in (dolly) camera movement. 2.5D parallax shift between the foreground mud and the distant horizon. Micro-animations: Steam faintly escaping the tank's vents, the catfolk's tail subtly swaying, distant smoke drifting, heavy, atmospheric light filtering through the clouds, subtle breathing motion. Looping action: The tank's shadow subtly lengthens and shrinks as if under slow-moving cloud cover.

prompts.image_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style. Close-up on the menacing front armor plate of a massive, crude, early WWI tank (Mark I/IV). The metal is scarred and muddy. Limited palette, visible pixels. The tank dominates the frame, emphasizing its monstrous scale and mechanical brutality.
prompts.video_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style, seamless loop. Close-up shot emphasizing the rough, riveted armor of the WWI tank. Subtle camera tilt upward, revealing the full height of the machine. 2.5D parallax layers: Heavy mud splatters in the foreground, the main tank body, and dark storm clouds in the background. Micro-animations: Faint oil sheen reflecting light, heavy particles of dust blowing across the chassis, intermittent sputtering smoke from the exhaust port, subtle flickering of light reflecting off the rivets. Looping action: A slow, heavy trickle of oil runs down a central rivet line.

prompts.image_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style. A massive, 30-ton Mark IV 'Land Ship' tank slowly plowing through a deep, muddy testing ground. The tank is tilted, emphasizing its struggle against the terrain. A catfolk engineer in heavy WWI overalls watches from the side. Dramatic, serious mood.
prompts.video_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style, seamless loop. A side view of the huge WWI tank slowly but relentlessly traversing a deep mud pit. Slow, subtle camera pan following the tank's movement. 2.5D parallax: Deep mud spray in the foreground, tank body, distant trenches/hills. Looping action: The track segments slowly rotate and churn through the mud.

prompts.image_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style. Extremely tight, claustrophobic interior view of the early WWI tank engine compartment. Fiery red light, heavy shadows. A sweating catfolk mechanic, goggles pushed up, intensely focused on a complex, hot engine block. Visibly vibrating machinery. Heavy, oppressive atmosphere.
prompts.video_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style, seamless loop. Claustrophobic interior shot focused on the roaring tank engine. Camera shakes slightly, simulating the engine vibration (micro handheld). 2.5D parallax: Foreground pipes/gauges, engine block, blurred background wall. Micro-animations: Intense, flickering orange light reflecting off the metal, visible heat shimmer rising from the engine block, small droplets of sweat dripping from the catfolk's brow, heavy smoke particles suspended in the air. prompts.image_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style. A dedicated catfolk mechanic in grease-stained WWI coveralls stands next to the track of the tank, gazing up at the massive machine with a look of intense, almost obsessive admiration and determination. Soft, dramatic lighting emphasizing his face.
prompts.video_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style, seamless loop. Medium shot of the catfolk mechanic standing beside the tank track. prompts.image_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style. A wide, dramatic shot of the muddy WWI testing ground. A massive Mark IV tank is stuck, heavily tilted, deep inside a waterlogged shell crater. The terrain is bleak and desolate. Visible pixel grid.
prompts.video_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style, seamless loop. Wide angle shot of the tank stuck in the crater. Micro-animations: Heavy, continuous jets of steam escaping violently from the tank's pressure relief valves (looping action), water dripping slowly off the tilted armor plates, subtle atmospheric dust swirling in the wind, light reflecting off the muddy water surface.

prompts.image_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style. A catfolk mechanic, covered in oil and mud, carefully climbing out of the small side hatch of the stuck tank. He is looking down intently at the complex, muddy transmission housing and track mechanism. High contrast lighting.
prompts.video_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style, seamless loop. Medium shot focused on the tank's lower hull and track area. The catfolk mechanic is partially visible, leaning out of the hatch, shining a small, looping beam of light (lantern/torch) onto the muddy transmission area. Gentle camera tilt down towards the tracks. 2.5D parallax: Foreground mud, the mechanic's body, the dark tank hull. Micro-animations: The small light beam subtly sweeps across the mechanism (looping action), fine dust motes dancing in the light, condensation dripping from the hull, the mechanic's ears rotating slightly as he listens to the machinery, his tail hangs down, barely swaying.

He is calm, focused, and professional, performing a routine check on the complex tank track mechanism. His expression shows concentration, not panic. The background is blurred, focusing on his steady hands working a wrench.
prompts.video_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style, seamless loop. Tight close-up on the mechanic's hands adjusting a bolt near the track. Micro-animations: Subtle glint of oily light on the metal, the catfolk's fingers flexing slightly, steam curling up from the hot metal, soft breathing motion visible in the shoulders. Looping action: The mechanic turns a large wrench exactly 90 degrees, pauses, and returns to the starting position.

prompts.image_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style. Extreme low-angle, focused shot highlighting the dangerous, tight gap between the massive, heavy tank track assembly and the main hull body. The proximity is menacing. The mechanic's foot or glove is visible dangerously close to the mechanism. Dark, foreboding lighting.
prompts.video_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style, seamless loop. Low-angle shot focusing on the narrow, dangerous clearance between the track and the hull. prompts.image_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style. High-action, dramatic shot. The massive tank track is visibly buckling and twisting, starting to derail violently off its mounts. Dust and debris explode outwards. The catfolk mechanic is frozen in shock nearby, realizing the imminent danger. Intense, high-contrast lighting.
prompts.video_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style, seamless loop. Tight shot on the tank track mechanism. The track violently lurches and buckles inward, throwing up spray and debris. Quick, sharp micro-shake of the camera (impact simulation). 2.5D parallax: Flying mud particles, the buckling track, the strained metal of the hull. Micro-animations: Sparks briefly fly from the grinding metal (looping action), heavy mud spray continuously loops, the metal visibly straining and vibrating, a cloud of dust rapidly expands and contracts.

prompts.image_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style. Cinematic, high-drama close-up. The catfolk mechanic is caught mid-lurch, his body twisted awkwardly against the massive, looming tank hull. His eyes are wide with shock, realizing he cannot escape the impending movement. Dynamic, diagonal composition.
prompts.video_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style, seamless loop. Tight shot focused on the mechanic's torso and the tank hull. Micro-animations: The mechanic's tail lashes once in panic and freezes, dust falling from the hull, his chest heaving rapidly (panic breathing), the fabric of his uniform visibly ripples from the sudden impact pressure.

prompts.image_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style. Extremely dark, grim, low-angle shot focused on the ground. The massive, heavy track of the tank is pressing down relentlessly into the thick, dark mud. Only a small part of the catfolk mechanic's WWI uniform (a glove or boot) is visible, half-submerged under the track. Heavy, oppressive shadows.
prompts.video_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style, seamless loop. Ground-level, static shot focusing on the crushed area. The massive, stationary tank track dominates the foreground (representing the fatal flaw). Above it, a faint, almost ghostly memory image shows the same catfolk mechanic bravely operating the tank under heavy shellfire in a trench (WWI combat scene overlay). Serious, tragic mood.
prompts.video_prompt: Retro 16-bit pixel art, SNES RPG cutscene style, seamless loop. A cinematic shot focused on the massive, silent tank, now motionless. Micro-animations: Distant, looping flashes of light simulating far-off artillery fire (memory/contrast), subtle shimmering heat haze rising from the metal, the catfolk's forgotten helmet gently rocking in the foreground mud (looping action), atmospheric fog drifting slowly across the scene.
